Name: Remove L1 Loosely Coupled related code
Description: Remove all code related to L1 Memory Loosely Coupled Configuration Access.

Name: L1 RVV Memory Access
Description: add RVV Access to L1 Memory. Add testing to check that it works.

Name: L1 Concurrent Access
Description: Concurrent Accesses should happen. Interesting case: RVV is trying to access 512 bits while MMIO is trying the same.

Name: L1 performance
Description: Lower priority - try to asses latency on both MMIO and RVV access

Name: L1 MMIO Memory Access
Description: L1 Memory MMIO Configuration Access. Done via IFD and ODR accesses.
Coverpoints if applicable: per_instance: cp_cid [AI_CORE_1 AI_CORE_2 AI_CORE_3 AI_CORE_4] cp_l1_bank [1:16] cross cid__l1_bank

Name: L1 MMIO Priority
Description: All requestors have equal priority in accessing L1. Equal priority means no bus starvation.

Name: L1 Memory Size
Description: Access L1 via MMIO aside from the AXI HP Slave Access and make sure max/min ranges are met. Good idea is to check wrap/addresses at power of 2.
Coverpoints if applicable: per_instance:  cp_cid [AI_CORE_1 AI_CORE_2 AI_CORE_3 AI_CORE_4] cp_l1_bank [1:16] cross cid__l1_bank

Name: L1 Mem Test
Description: [For code cov] Verify L1 Memory Test function.

Name: L1 Deadlock
Description: [For code cov] Check L1 Dead Lock by disabling response to L1 HP AXI Master. Make sure behavior matches macro specificationss.

Name: L1 HP Back to Back
Description: [For code cov] Issue back to back transactions to L1 HP AXI Slave interface.

Name: Sideband CID
Description: Drive sideband CID signal via virtual interface. Verify by accessing L1.

Name: Sideband PMU Signals
Description: PMU Signals will be driven according to the boot-up sequence. Any test using L1 indirectly verifies proper boot-up.  PMU signals are tested in AI Core top level.
Coverpoints if applicable: cp_light_sleep [ENABLED DISABLED] cp_deep_sleep [ENABLED DISABLED] cp_shutdown [ENABLED DISABLED]
